intro: Eurya serrata var. euprusta, commonly known as the serrated eurya, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its fruits are small, bright red berries that ripen in the fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
